intro: Silene stewartiana, commonly known as Stewart's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces delicate pink or white flowers with five petals, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Silene stewartiana is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
